fields.description:
The recent Confluence upgrade that occurred on or about a couple of hours before 21 Feb 2017, 4:42:41 AM ET broke on add-on. We immediately started getting Javascript errors on functions where we had extended jQuery. We noticed it hitting our first 2 instances in the IST time zone just after the update window and then later rolled into our ET instance noted above.

We noticed with the latest upgrade that the web resources being loaded included an older version of jQuery (1.7.2) than what we were including in our add-on (1.8.3).  Once the web resources were loaded all of our functions we added to jQuery and all of our event handlers added before the load were missing because basically it's a new version of jQuery being loaded on in the iframe. 

Through a series of console logs we determined that our add-on starts out using jQuery 1.8.3 where we extend and add event handlers.  Dumping the jQuery events we confirmed they were added fine.  Both the jQuery reference and the $ reference referred to the same jQuery 1.8.3 version.  

Our add-on then loads the web resources.  This ends up loading jQuery 1.7.2. After loading the web resources there is a period of time where the jQuery() reference refers to 1.7.2 and the $ reference refers to 1.8.3.  At this point our handlers are available in $ but not in jQuery(). At some point in time after the web resource is fully loaded and executed both $ and jQuery() refer to 1.7.2.  

We thought about possibly skipping the loading of jQuery as part of the web resources but noticed that is says "Modified by Atlassian" in the header.
fields.summary: Confluence includes jQuery as web resource and overwriting our add-on's version of jQuery

fields.description:
Calling AP.request() on a non-existent resource used to result in the 'error' callback being called.  Now it seems the 'success' callback gets called with no response value.

This is what we now see when debugging all.js:
 !Screen Shot 2017-03-01 at 3.55.50 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Also, this is the corresponding AP.request documentation from https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/javascript/RequestProperties.html:

{quote}success	function	
a callback function executed on a 200 success status code
error	function	
a callback function executed when a HTTP status error code is returned{quote}
fields.summary: AP.request() no longer calling 'error' callback function on 404

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A support case was raised where some of a customer's Gliffy diagrams in Confluence failed to load. Gliffy's servers returned a 401:

bq. HTTP Status 401 - Expecting claim 'qsh' to have value 'c98040f497fbad428a6a131e61f38d0ef8f3ec8c50893c308de3f3c0be496398' but instead it has the value 'ce0229c8452efd4e6497ff8d4e986d98590eff4b4df37693bb344e756cfb2a7f'

The common element between the diagrams that failed to load is that they have a comma in the diagram name. Creating a brand new diagram with a comma in the name also fails to load.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Install the Connect version of Gliffy on a Confluence Cloud instance
# Create a new page, and a new diagram on that page, save it as "Test"
# Create a second diagram on the page, name it "Test, again"
# Save the page

h3. Expected results
Both Gliffy diagrams display on the Confluence page.

h3. Actual results
The first diagram loads, the second with the comma in the name does not.

h3. Workaround
Follow [these instructions|https://www.gliffy.com/user-manual/?productId=1#article_78] to rename the diagrams to remove the comma.
fields.summary: Gliffy diagrams with commas in the diagram name cause qsh check to fail

fields.description:
We are developers of the Archiving Plugin for Confluence.

Our add-on batch-archives pages by moving them between spaces. Our customers frequently archive tens of thousands of pages in one go, sometimes even more. "Page move" does not need to be hyper-fast, but is expected to be complete in tens of minutes or in some hours most (overnight) even for this scale of data.

"Page move" has been a fairly fast operation in Confluence 5.7, and it became significantly slower some time between 5.7 and 5.10. (As far as I know the "Move page" feature has been rewritten in some Confluence version released around that time.)

Our profiling results:

|| Operation ||	1.014M pages in Confluence 5.7.6 || 5.8.18 metric ||	380K pages in Confluence 5.10.1 ||
| Page archiving with MOVE | 40 minutes (for 1555 pages) | N/A | 1.1 hours (for 400 pages - stable, but slower!) |

1555/40 = 39 page moved per minute in Confluence 5.7
400/66 = 6 page moved per minute in Confluence 5.10 

_6/39 means it is 85% slower than it used to be!_

Is there any chance to accelerate page moves in Confluence core? 
Or offer an API to batch-move multiple pages? (Currently, the API limits us to move one page at a time.)

**Update 02/06/2017**

Joint investigation by [~aron.gombas] and [~psemeniuk] (see comment thread below) showed that regression happened somewhere between 5.8.18 and 6.0.1:

|| || 5.8.0 || 5.8.18 || 6.0.1 ||
| Execution time | 23 m 10 s | 12 m 36 s | 23 m 53 s |

Regression is present both in memory consumption and cpu usage. As Aron proved increasing memory brings page move time by 30% but it still not up to par with what it was.

Possible area is either `DefaultRelatedContentRefactorer` class or it's clients.
fields.summary: "Move page" is 85% slower in Confluence 5.10+ than in 5.8.18, making moving large number of pages very inefficient

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Add a WebPanel app to your atlassian-connect.json with the "location" set to "atl.footer"
# Add the context-parameter {{space.key}} to the URL of that webPanel
# Add a customContent type with a uiSupport.listViewComponent set (so that a menu item on space-level gets added)
# Install the atlassian-connect.json
# Navigate the customContent page (the one referenced in listViewComponent), using the link in the space sidebar.


*What happens:*

The URL of the WebPanel app does not contain a spaceKey ({{space.key}} is replaced with an empty string).

*What should happen:*

The URL should contain the correct spaceKey. And if a dialog is opened from the webPanel, using AP.dialog.create(...), then the URL of that dialog app should also contain the spaceKey (if {{space.key}} was specified there).
fields.summary: Context-parameter {space.key} is empty in webPanels loaded on custom-content pages

fields.description:
In the following I use the Scroll ImageMap macro as an example however this applies to all Dynamic Macros I tested so far.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create two pages
# On page1 insert an Excerpt and place e.g. ImageMap macro inside it
# On page2 insert Excerpt Include macro and choose page1 as the source of the excerpt

*Expected result:*
ImageMap macro is rendered on page2

*Actual result:*
ImageMap macro is not rendered.

My gut feeling is that the request is not correctly authenticated by the bridge in this scenario:

Request failing is:
{code}https://k15t-dev.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/56992313/history/6/macro/id/9842095b-f053-43d3-9235-da4021f924b9?_=1485417792015{code}

Error received:
{code}{"statusCode":404,"data":{"authorized":false,"valid":true,"errors":[],"successful":false},"message":"No macro found on content id : ContentId{id=56992313} with version: 6 and macroId: 9842095b-f053-43d3-9235-da4021f924b9"}{code}

fields.description:
Content Property extractions, uiSupport.

This documentation: https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/fragment/user-interface-support.html#dataUri

* Suggests to return an array of options, this is incorrect.  It needs to return an object with two fields {{suggestedResults}} and {{searchResults}}.
* The {{suggestedResults}} and {{searchResults}} should follow the example (object of id and text).
* It's unclear what each field exactly represents but i think its like this:
** suggestedResults - anything relevant to the user but doesn't need to match the {{query}} param
** searchResults - a subset of the data set matching the {{query}} param
fields.summary: Incorrect Example in dataUri Documentation

fields.description:
When trying to store/retrieve any custom Java objects with BandanaManager in *Confluence 6.0.0-beta3*, the following error occurs:

{code}
com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.ConversionException: XStream error: Class com.simplenia.confluence.plugins.customdashboards.data.DashboardFilterRule has not been whitelisted
{code}

I'm a bit surprised to see this change, as it has always been possible to store/retrieve custom Java objects using BandanaManager. Atlassian even mentions this in the documentation: https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/development-resources/confluence-architecture/confluence-internals/persistence-in-confluence

*Bandana is an Atlassian framework for persistence of arbitrary Java objects.*

Is this change really intended? This is going to break lots of plugins for sure...

Any help/advise would be appreciated

Thanks,
Remo
fields.summary: In Confluence 6.0.0-beta3 BandanaManager is not able to store/retrieve custom Java objects anymore

- Insert macro from the connect add-on either by using 
-- the '+' button at the top of the page, or 
-- '{' followed by "Open macro browser"
- Follow prompts of the custom editor and click insert

What should happen:
Macro is added to the page, and it is visible in the edit screen

What actually happens:
No macro is added, work is lost, customers get sad

fields.description:
When calling confluence.getMacroData(function(params) { }), the params object is not populated correctly. 

For example, the value "E=mc^2" comes out as "E\" instead. I can see that the value is stored as data-macro-parameters="body=E\=mc^2", so the getMacroData function is not unescaping the values properly.

I believe the error started within the past couple weeks. I've tested with 6.0.0-OD-2016.08.1-0001 and the error does not occur on that version.

This is a huge frustration for my customers, so a quick resolution would be much appreciated.

fields.description:
During the blitz two Searchbox to Livesearch migration issues were brought up regarding the spaceKey field:
* Field values such as @personal and @favourite create drop downs next to the search field with stuff in them.
* Multiple spaces can be specified in the field, which creates a dropdown with those spaces in it.

After discussing with [~bswift], we've decided to handle these by deprecating both pieces of functionality, as there is no equivalent in livesearch and it would require adding the feature. In both cases, the Searchbox will revert to its default functionality, which is to search the current space.

Wether by ignoring the field and not putting it in the map or by setting a default value.

fields.description:
{{/wiki/rest/api/content/.../restriction/byOperation/.../user?userName=...}} returns a 404 error in all the following cases:

* The content does not exist (consistent with documentation)
* The specified user does not exist (not documented, I'd expect a 400 error)
* The specified user does not have permission to view the content (consistent with documentation)
* No explicit restriction has been added for the specified user (this should be a 200 response with a boolean {{false}} in the body). This is the only response that doesn't have a body explaining what happened.

If an explicit restriction has been added for the specified user, a 200 response with an empty is returned.

Also, if a user name or key is not specified, the following error message is returned. But the name of the user key parameter is actually just *{{key}}*.

{code}
either userName or userKey should not be <null>
{code}
fields.summary: /content/.../restriction/byOperation/.../user returns ambiguous responses

fields.description:
We currently need to explicitly add this file to our download list because it is not included in referenced CSS URIs in the conversion result.
{code}s/_/_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-view-file-macro:view-file-macro-resources/vfm.css}}{code}

The styles in this files are not included in the CSS batches and we need to them for correct image positioning, especially for inline images.

Please note that we currently need to download it from the Confluence server instead of the CDN because we can't guess the respective CDN url, if there is any.

fields.description:
We are receiving reports from users that our add-on macro is not being saved in Confluence cloud.  We use a custom macro editor that saves a macro using AP.confluence.saveMacro().  
I can personally reproduce the following scenario for our Gliffy macros:

- create a new macro
- close the macro editor without saving
- create a new macro using the dropdown - insert option (not by typing {name).
- save the macro 
- save the page
- macro does not get added to the page and is lost.

It looks like this is related to closed issue https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/CE-982, which was perhaps only partially fixed.  Please investigate ASAP, as this is contributing to lost work for many of our customers

There was a commit at one point with matching changes in connect, but these seem to have been reverted somehow.

Breaking changes relate to [CRA-1214|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRA-1214]

fields.description:
The Style macro allows users to add custom stylesheets to Confluence Cloud content. These styles do not get applied to Connect macros (dynamic macros) as they are rendered inside an iframe.  

Steps to reproduce:
# Insert a dynamic macro in a page (any dynamic macro will expose this issue)
# Insert the Style macro in the page and populate with data 

Result: 
* Expected: the page content, including the dynamic macro content, should render using the specified styles
* Actual: only the page content outside of the dynamic macro renders using the specified styles

Reason:
* The dynamic macro is rendered inside an iframe and application of custom stylesheets in child iframes isn't supported by default.

{panel:bgColor=#efefef}
h3. Next steps:
This issue is technically complex to resolve. We're investigating options at this point so as to determine the best way forwards. 
{panel}
fields.summary: Custom stylesheets are not applied to Connect Macros

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Create a group and give it the name "FOO" (uppercase)
# Make a GET request to this endpoint `/rest/api/group/FOO`

*What happens:*

In the response of the REST API the group name is always lowercase. Also, for example, if that group is added to the permissions of some space and then the permissions are queried through a REST request then the group name is also lowercase in the response.

*What should happen:*

The REST endpoints should return the group names in the correct case.
fields.summary: Group names are returned in lowercase in the response of REST requests

fields.description:
We've found a reproducible problem that may or may not be related to Synchrony. The problem causes evaluation of Gliffy in new cloud instances of Confluence to fail (and may affect other macros on pages). This corresponds with a recent period of decline in Gliffy's new license business in Confluence Cloud and I believe should be triaged with high priority. 


JavaScript Error:
{noformat}
21:24:33.434 synchrony.atlassian.io/v1/data/-cffcb1a4-5dd3-3d28-90e9-75be0180b495/confluence-229377?state-at=@head&state-format=type-tagged&rewrite-request=true&cached=true:1 POST https://synchrony.atlassian.io/v1/data/-cffcb1a4-5dd3-3d28-90e9-75be0180b495/confluence-229377?state-at=@head&state-format=type-tagged&rewrite-request=true&cached=true 404 ()
{noformat}


Reproduction: 

1) Provision a new Confluence Cloud instance
2) Install Gliffy Add-on
3) After Gliffy Add-on installation process is complete - edit a page and add diagram (using either “Add macro” or selecting “Gliffy Diagram” from the “Insert more content” drop down)
3.1) Note: when adding macro by typing “{“ on a page in edit mode - “Gliffy” macro does not show up in the list of macros
4) “No macro metadata” error dialog appears
5) Publish page
6) Edit page again
7) Add Gliffy diagram - this time Diagram editor is launched and user is able to create/edit diagram w/o any problem.

Further error details:

- I create a new trial Confluence
- I add a trial version of the Gliffy plugin.
- When I create my first page, I see a 404 error to [synchrony.atlassian.io|http://synchrony.atlassian.io]
- I try to create a Gliffy macro, and get the no macro meta-data error, the end point we define for our custom macro editor in the atlassian-descriptor.json is never called.
- I create a new page
- I do not see the 404 error to [synchrony.atlassian.io|http://synchrony.atlassian.io] 
- I am now able to add a Gliffy macro.

.

----- Email transcript follows -----

.

fields.description:
CE-1064 - I forgot to configure for the add-on user, and only did groups within confluence

When an add-on is installed and it has space permission support for custom content, need to configure the space permissions for the add-on user in the default space permissions and existing spaces
fields.summary: Configure custom content permissions for add-on user on plugin install

fields.description:
We are experiencing a delay in the despalying of the macro of our Balsamiq Mockups 3 for Confluence Cloud add-on.

The macro shows a PNG attached in the page.

The macro takes several seconds to display the content or fails.

We did our test on this instance

https://balsamiq.atlassian.net
fields.summary: Degraded performance in fetching binary file from attachment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Fixed table headers/sticky table headers does not work when certain feature in [Advanced Table|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.table/cloud/overview] (by Bob Swift) Macro is being enabled

h3. How to Replicate

# Have confluence *5.9* and above
# install the plugin Advanced Tables for Confluence and license it with a timebomb license
# create a page, and add the storage format added in this ticket: [^storageformat.txt]
#* we may need to add more rows for easier view
# save the page, scroll down
# *expected behavior* the table has a fixed header 
# *actual behavior* : The fixed header does not work:
# edit the page and disable the auto total parameter
# the fixed header now works
fields.summary: Fixed headers do not work for Advanced table macro produced tables when auto total row enabled

fields.description:
Users are reporting that when you try to insert a macro the system gives the following error:
"There is no metadata configured for this macro which means no configuration screen can be presented here.
If this is a user macro then you can add metadata to the template using the User Macro Administration console."
fields.summary: Balsamiq add-on cannot create a macro

fields.description:
The current implementation of JobConfigModuleDescriptor looks for a ModuleDescriptor by the key of the job it's configured with. The documentation says that this module should be a component. However, plugins using spring-scanner do not have component modules, and only have `@Component` or `@Named` annotated spring beans. We need to fix JobConfigModuleDescriptor to resolve the component by key from the plugin's spring context instead.

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.JobConfigModuleDescriptor.getJobRunner(JobConfigModuleDescriptor.java:331)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.JobConfigModuleDescriptor.newManagedScheduledJob(JobConfigModuleDescriptor.java:345)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.JobConfigModuleDescriptor.enabled(JobConfigModuleDescriptor.java:271)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.notifyModuleEnabled(DefaultPluginManager.java:1991)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.enableConfiguredPluginModule(DefaultPluginManager.java:1738)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.enableConfiguredPluginModules(DefaultPluginManager.java:1715)
{noformat}
fields.summary: JobConfigModuleDescriptor is not compatible with spring-scanner plugins
